spatial_accuracy.notes: Overall room cluster resembles the 2D plan (Dining top-left, Kitchen top-center, Bedroom bottom-left, Living right, Toilet/Wash core), but major spatial deviations exist: the main Entrance zone/door is not positioned on the top-right as in the plan and instead appears shifted to the bottom/center edge. The large bottom-right Stair/UP volume from the plan is not correctly represented (space shape/use differs). Several door locations/swing orientations in the central core (Bedroom↔hall and Wash/Toilet access) appear inconsistent. Window placement differs notably on Bedroom and some service walls.

structural_fidelity.notes: Key structural element (staircase) is missing/incorrectly modeled. Adjacency is partially preserved (Dining adjacent to Kitchen; Living adjacent to hall/core), but the Entrance adjacency and circulation path differ. Wall thickness looks generally consistent, but door embedding and the openings to the Entrance/Stair zone do not match the plan. No clear evidence of the plan’s stair flight/landing geometry.

furniture_mapping.notes: Dining table/chairs, bedroom bed, and living seating are present and generally plausible, but not tightly matched to the 2D layout (living arrangement and clearances differ; some furniture appears repositioned relative to walls/openings). Scale is mostly consistent, though circulation clearances around the central core look tighter than the plan suggests.

aesthetic_quality.notes: Isometric camera is consistent and readable; lighting is clean with minimal artifacts. Geometry is mostly clean, but the bottom-right zone reads as an undefined/incorrect volume (hurting clarity). Overall presentation quality is good despite plan fidelity issues.

detected_errors.description: Main entrance location is misplaced: 2D plan shows entrance at the top-right; 3D render depicts the primary exterior door/opening at the bottom/center edge.
Staircase (UP) shown in the bottom-right of the 2D plan is missing as a stair flight/landing in the 3D render.
Bottom-right area is modeled as an undefined room/volume rather than the plan’s stair zone, altering circulation and spatial intent.
Multiple interior door swing/orientation inconsistencies in the central core (Bedroom/hall and Wash/Toilet access) relative to the 2D plan door arcs.
Bedroom window placement differs: plan indicates a window on the left wall (and additional opening), but the 3D render emphasizes windows on the bottom wall with no clear left-wall bedroom window.
Proportion distortion in the bottom-right zone: the plan’s stair volume footprint and subdivision are not preserved in the 3D model.
Hall/room-like space appears in the bottom-right where the plan specifies stairs; this reads as a hallucinated functional space replacing the stairs.
